item.title: qiskit-ibm-transpiler Ranks #3 in Unitary Foundation 2025 Survey
item.description:
üöÄ üöÄüöÄ Climbing the ranks in quantum software!

I’m thrilled to share that the qiskit-ibm-transpiler library has moved up to #3 in the Unitary Foundation 2025 Survey under Full-stack development platforms, compilers, and simulators. Just last year, we were #4 ‚Äî and this year‚Äôs leap is a testament to the incredible work of the team behind it.

In less than two years, the package has surpassed 929K downloads, becoming a relevant tool for quantum circuit optimization/transpilation across the community.

One of the most exciting updates this year: our AI transpiler passes ‚Äî including the latest Pauli Networks pass ( arXiv:2503.14448) ‚Äî can now run in local mode, removing the need for an IBM Quantum premium plan. This makes advanced AI-powered transpilation more accessible than ever.

The Unitary Fund survey is widely recognized as the primary pulse check for quantum software adoption and developer preferences. Seeing our work reflected there is both humbling and energizing.

Huge kudos to the amazing team behind this David Kremer, V√≠ctor Villar Pascual, Jes√∫s Talavera G√≥mez, Yaiza Garc√≠a Mart√≠n-Mantero, Ismael Faro ‚Äî your dedication, creativity, and deep technical insight are what make this possible. And thank you to the community for your continued trust and feedback.

Let‚Äôs keep pushing the boundaries of quantum + AI software together.

#QuantumComputing #Qiskit #IBMQuantum #AITranspiler #UnitaryFund #QuantumSoftware #OpenSource #AIforQuantum

Originally shared on LinkedIn on November 10, 2025 - 50 reactions as of 11/11/2025

item.title: IEEE Quantum Week in Albuquerque: AI and Quantum Computing at IBM Quantum
item.description:
üöÄ Excited to be attending IEEE Quantum Week in Albuquerque, New Mexico! I’ll be sharing some of the work we’re doing at IBM Quantum, especially at the intersection of AI and Quantum Computing. If you’re around and passionate about Quantum, AI, or both‚Äîlet’s connect! Here’s where you can find me:

üß† Today, Sunday, August 31 ‚Äì 4:00PM Paper Presentation: “Quantum Processing Unit (QPU) Processing Time Prediction with Machine Learning”. We’ll explore how ML can improve QPU time prediction for quantum jobs‚Äîenabling smarter quantum workload scheduling.

üõ†Ô∏è Monday, September 1 ‚Äì 10:00AM Tutorial: “TUT13 ‚Äî AI Methods for Quantum Circuit Optimization”. Together with David Kremer, we’ll demonstrate how Reinforcement Learning can be used to transpile and synthesize quantum circuits, using qiskit-ibm-transpiler and other tools developed by our team.

üí° Tuesday, September 2 ‚Äì 12:00PM Live Demo at IBM Quantum Booth #400. I’ll demo our new AI-powered quantum computing development environment‚Äîdesigned to bridge the gap between quantum theory and practical implementation in a visual way.

If you’re attending and want to talk about AI for Quantum, Quantum+AI, or our work at IBM Quantum‚Äîfeel free to reach out or stop by!

#IEEEQuantumWeek #IBMQuantum #QuantumComputing #AIforQuantum #QuantumPlusAI

Originally shared on LinkedIn on August 31, 2025 - 42 reactions, 2 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: AI Transpiler Passes Enable Quantum Volume Breakthrough on IBM Hardware
item.description:
üöÄ Great to see this progress on the quantum hardware side! üöÄ

I’m also really proud of our work on the AI transpiler passes that enabled this advancement in quantum volume. When I started working with David Kremer, Ivan Duran Martinez, Hanhee Paik and Ismael Faro on these AI-powered passes, we were motivated to push the limits of transpilation to deliver the best results to our clients.

It’s incredibly rewarding to see how our efforts are making real impact, like what Jay Gambetta has highlighted here.

Thanks to the entire team involved in the AI transpiler passes - V√≠ctor Villar Pascual, Jes√∫s Talavera G√≥mez, Yaiza Garc√≠a Mart√≠n-Mantero, Ayushi Dubal, Sanjay Vishwakarma, and many others - this kind of progress is only possible through all of our effort! üôåüôåüôå

Context In response to: Jay Gambetta’s post on quantum volume achievements celebrating IBM’s r3 beta QPU (ibm_pittsburgh) achieving quantum volume milestones of 1024 and 2048, utilizing AI-optimized transpilation circuits developed by our team.

Originally shared on LinkedIn on August 27, 2025 - 31 reactions, 0 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Pauli Network Circuit Synthesis with Reinforcement Learning Paper Published
item.description:
Really happy to see the paper on arxiv. The described AI-powered transpiler pass for Pauli Networks has been available in the Qiskit Transpiler Service since last November 2024, as presented in the Quantum Developer Conference 2024 Check out the paper https://arxiv.org/abs/2503.14448 and the related documentation on how to use it https://docs.quantum.ibm.com/guides/ai-transpiler-passes#ai-circuit-synthesis-passes

Context: In response to Ayushi Dubal’s post about the Reinforcement Learning-based synthesis pass for Pauli Networks (Clifford + arbitrary angle Pauli rotation circuits). The research paper Pauli Network Circuit Synthesis with Reinforcement Learning was presented at the American Physical Society March Meeting in Anaheim.

Originally shared on LinkedIn on March 19, 2025 - 16 reactions, 2 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Qiskit Code Assistant Now Compatible with OpenAI Completions API
item.description:
Exciting update! The Qiskit Code Assistant service now exposes compatible endpoints with OpenAI’s Completions API. This integration enables seamless usage via existing libraries (OpenAI, LiteLLM, etc.), making it easy to infuse Qiskit knowledge into your LLM pipelines.

Learn more: https://quantum.cloud.ibm.com/docs/en/guides/qiskit-code-assistant-openai-api

#qiskit #QiskitCodeAssistant #IBMQuantum #openai

item.title: Qiskit HumanEval: Evaluation Benchmark for Quantum Code Generation Published
item.description:
Excited to share our new research paper introducing the Qiskit HumanEval dataset! üöÄ

This work addresses a critical need: evaluating Large Language Models’ capability to generate quantum computing code. Our dataset comprises more than 100 quantum computing tasks, each with accompanying prompts, solutions, test cases, and difficulty ratings.

We systematically tested LLMs on their ability to produce executable quantum code, demonstrating the feasibility of using generative AI tools in quantum code development and establishing important benchmarks for the field.

This research opens new possibilities for AI-assisted quantum software development and provides a standardized way to measure progress in this exciting intersection of quantum computing and artificial intelligence.

Read the paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/2406.14712v1

#quantumcomputing #ibmquantum #qiskit #llms

Originally shared on LinkedIn on July 3, 2024 - 70 reactions, 7 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Optimize Quantum Circuits with AI-Powered Transpiler Passes
item.description:
Exciting updates from our team at the convergence of AI and quantum computing! üöÄ

We have released a bunch of new features in the Qiskit transpiler service and the Qiskit Code Assistant projects that continue unlocking the potential of applying classical AI into Quantum computing.

Recent releases include: üîπ Beta version of the Qiskit transpiler service (unveiled at #THINK24) üîπ Research paper on AI methods enabling AI-powered transpiler passes üîπ Qiskit Code Assistant with accompanying paper introducing LLMs and the Qiskit HumanEval benchmark

Both projects have received recognition through the IBM Quantum Challenge, with fantastic feedback from participants who got to experience the power of AI-driven quantum optimization firsthand!

This work represents a major step forward in making quantum computing more efficient and accessible through the integration of artificial intelligence.

Original post: https://www.ibm.com/quantum/blog/ai-transpiler-passes

Originally shared on LinkedIn on June 17, 2024 - 39 reactions, 1 comment as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Qiskit Code Assistant: Training LLMs for Quantum Code Generation Paper Published
item.description:
Excited to share our research paper on training specialized LLMs for quantum computing code generation using Qiskit! üöÄ

Code Large Language Models have emerged as powerful tools, revolutionizing the software development landscape by automating coding tasks. However, quantum programming presents unique challenges compared to classical coding.

Our work addresses:

  • The scarcity of quantum code examples
  • The rapidly evolving nature of the quantum computing field
  • Custom benchmarking similar to HumanEval for quantum-specific tasks

The results are promising: our model outperforms existing state-of-the-art quantum computing models!

This research represents an important step toward making quantum programming more accessible through AI assistance.

Read the paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.19495v1

#qiskit #genAI #codegen #LLMs #IBMQuantum

Originally shared on LinkedIn on June 17, 2024 - 45 reactions, 3 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Reinforcement Learning for Quantum Transpiling: Research Paper Published
item.description:
Excited to share research demonstrating the integration of Reinforcement Learning (RL) into quantum transpiling workflows for the Qiskit transpiler service! üöÄ

This work achieves near-optimal circuit synthesis and routing with significant performance improvements over traditional optimization methods like SAT solvers.

Key achievements: ‚úÖ Linear Function, Clifford, and Permutation circuit synthesis up to 65 qubits ‚úÖ Substantial reductions in two-qubit gate depth for routing up to 133 qubits ‚úÖ Performance advantages over SABRE routing heuristics ‚úÖ Practical efficiency for quantum transpiling pipelines

This research represents a major step forward in making quantum computing more efficient and accessible through AI-powered optimization.

Big thanks to the amazing team: David Kremer, V√≠ctor Villar Pascual, Hanhee Paik, Ivan Duran Martinez, and Ismael Faro!

Read the paper: https://lnkd.in/dcnw4Zav

#qiskit #quantumcomputing #IBMQuantum

Originally shared on LinkedIn on June 17, 2024 - 48 reactions, 0 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.description:
I’m extremely proud of this massive release including two projects from my team: the Qiskit Transpiler (with the AI transpiling passes) and the Qiskit Code Assistant üöÄ

Qiskit SDK 1.x represents full-stack software for all things quantum, featuring:

  • Qiskit Transpiler with AI-powered optimization
  • Qiskit Runtime
  • Qiskit Serverless
  • AI Code Assistant

More updates and info coming soon!

Context: In response to IBM Quantum’s post announcing Qiskit SDK v1.0, introducing the full-stack software for quantum computing with Qiskit Transpiler, Qiskit Runtime, Qiskit Serverless, and the AI Code Assistant.

item.title: IBM Quantum Recruiting AI Engineer Interns in Spain
item.description:
We’re recruiting AI Engineer interns based in Spain for the IBM Quantum team! üöÄ

We are introducing new AI-based capabilities in our software stack, including:

  • AI circuit transpilers compatible with Qiskit
  • LLM-powered code assistants

As an intern, you would support:

  • AI model training and deployment
  • Software service development
  • MLOps work

We’ve already received over 100 applications, and our team of international engineers is welcoming to newcomers. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain practical AI experience combined with quantum computing knowledge!

Apply here: https://lnkd.in/gvQqix-c

#AIEngineer #internship #Spain #IBMQuantum

item.title: IBM Quantum Summit 2023: Major Announcements on Quantum Utility
item.description:
I am thrilled and honored by the major announcements from IBM Quantum Summit 2023! üöÄ

Key highlights advancing quantum utility:

Hardware Breakthroughs:

  • IBM Heron chip: 3-5x device performance improvement over Eagle
  • IBM Condor: 1,121-processor system demonstrating scaling solutions
  • IBM Quantum System Two: Now operational at Yorktown Lab with 3 Heron processors

Software Innovations:

  • Qiskit 1.0: Scheduled February release with improvements in circuit construction, compilation times, and memory consumption
  • Quantum Serverless: Beta deployment for scaled pattern execution
  • AI Integration: Automated code development via watsonx and enhanced transpiler tools

Vision: Extended roadmap through 2033

Academic and industry partners from University of Tokyo, Argonne National Lab, BasQ, and others showcased utility-scale quantum applications.

This represents tremendous progress toward realizing the full potential of quantum computing!

Context: In response to Jay Gambetta’s post about IBM Quantum Summit 2023 announcements, highlighting hardware and software advances toward quantum utility.

Originally shared on LinkedIn on December 7, 2023 - 6 reactions, 0 comments as of 11/12/2025
